intro: Anemonoides keiskeana, commonly known as the Japanese anemone, is a flowering plant native to Japan and Korea. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its showy, single or double pink to white flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with pinnately divided, fern-like leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Anemonoides keiskeana is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and early summer blooms.
